text: Mescalero-Chiricahua language originated from Apache Tribe in South Central New Mexico between 1000 and 1500 CE. The Apache tribe is known for its Fierce and cunning culture. It belongs to the Apachean branch of the Athabaskan language family. The language is closely related to Navajo and Western Apache; more distantly related to Jicarilla, Plains Apache, and Hupa. Category:Languages of the United States
title: Mescalero-Chiricahua language
